attributes.action: Give CB Radio Users in the UK back our UHF CB Radio Band !
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Prime Minister,
CB radio users in the UK used to have 2 very distinct frequency allocations; 27MHz, and 934MHz.
With the advent of mobile phones, our 934MHz band was taken away from us, but has never been used since.
The proposal is that we are given a frequency allocation in the UHF TV band, as the advent of Digital TV will free up some of this part of the radio frequency spectrum.
A suggestion of 476 - 477MHz is made, this would enable the use of readily available UHF CB radio equipment (subject to approval) such as that used in Australia.
CB radio is still a very popular form of communication,  and its popularity is increasing since 27MHz CB Radio became license free in December 2006.
Thank you, and 73's (best wishes in CB lingo !)
